item.title: Github Actions - simple CI/CD
item.description: Hello fellows! Good to see you all. It was a really busy time but it happened - finally found time to write some post about my observations related with GitHub Actions as a good CICD solution that costs almost nothing. Why do I need CI/CD? That’s a good question though. First you need to think if: you have some tasks like some unit / integration tests you would like to run every time you push new commit to the branch it takes you a lot of time to run all the commands and do the app release you want to verify each time your commits quality is good enough (e.

item.title: Christmas time and New Year's Eve - time for summary
item.description: Hello fellows. I hope you’re doing well and maybe bake some delicious christmas cakes. That was a preety long year for me. Especially when I list some events there: Learning .NET Core and Angular Making diploma project and finishing my CS studies with 5.0 grade Developing my Java and Python skills Unexpected changing a job (which maybe I will describe in the future) But now it’s time to slow down, take a deep breath and spend some time with closest people out there.
